qas.question: Who was the daughter of Peneus?
Who shot Daphne with a leaden arrow?

context: <a0_0>Daphne<a0_0/> was a nymph, daughter of the river god Peneus, who had scorned Apollo. The myth explains the connection of Apollo with δάφνη (daphnē), the laurel whose leaves his priestess employed at Delphi. In Ovid's Metamorphoses, Phoebus Apollo chaffs Cupid for toying with a weapon more suited to a man, whereupon Cupid wounds him with a golden dart; simultaneously, however, <a2_0>Cupid<a2_0/> shoots a leaden arrow into Daphne, causing her to be repulsed by Apollo. Following a spirited chase by Apollo, Daphne prays to her father, <a1_0>Peneus<a1_0/>, for help, and he changes her into the laurel tree, sacred to Apollo.
